title: Bonkers Republican bill in Idaho would make mRNA-based vaccination a crime
description: It's unclear if the two lawmakers know what messenger RNA is exactly.

title: This bionic finger uses touch to “see” inside human tissue, electronics
description: Subsurface tactile tomography can detect details beneath a material's surface.

title: Did the UK government just accidentally leak Nintendo’s Switch successor?
description: A telltale “and” in a CMA report appendix has speculation running wild.

title: Android’s new OEM rules in India swap “requirements” with “revenue sharing”
description: Just like the EU, if Google can't require OEMs to bundle apps, it'll just pay them.

title: Amazon hamstrings free app that makes Fire TV remotes reprogrammable
description: Amazon would rather you buy its $35 remote for button customization.

title: Starlink’s “Global Roaming” promises worldwide access for $200 a month
description: Some people still waiting for regular Starlink get invites for $200 roaming plan.

title: Lance Bass was kicked off a Russian spaceflight two decades ago—now he’s back
description: "They would put a gun to my head and be like, 'Where's the money?'"

title: Is your Facebook account worth $12 a month? Meta rolls out subscription program
description: It’s currently being rolled out in Australia and New Zealand.

title: Twitter’s two-factor authentication change “doesn’t make sense”
description: Security experts baffled by move to require paid subscription to get SMS sign-in codes.

title: Mostly hits with a few misses: The Lucid Air Grand Touring, reviewed
description: Lucid's target was to better the Mercedes S-Class, not the Tesla Model S.

title: Almost-unbeatable AI comes to Gran Turismo 7
description: GT Sophy beat the world's best players in 2022; now you can race it yourself.

title: Atomic Heart impressions: Shock-ingly good shooting
description: Familiar setup but more kinetic combat in this dystopian RPG-lite shooter.

title: Hope and doubt collide in an eventful episode 6 of The Last of Us
description: Plus, Kyle and Andrew use any excuse to talk about post-apocalyptic energy politics.
